item.title: Case study
item.description: Info This fictional scenario is presented to you as an option to do this simulation exercise without utilizing your application. However, the guidelines at the bottom of this page should still be taken into account. Contoso is a well-known and historical clothing retailer with a historically storng high-street presence. Their stores are constantly crowded, therefore joining a waiting list may be necessary to ensure entry. item.title: Current environment
item.description: The e-commerce website is hosted on virtual machines and uses a NoSQL database as data store for product information and session state. A search engined provides search functionality over diverse product catalogs, traffic spikes, and rapidly changing inventory. More information were provided by Contoso IT staff along with the following architecture. Application design Contoso’s e-commerce webiste consists of a three tier application hosted in East US and West Europe with multiple virtual machines running the front end, mid-tier, database, and search engine.
